steps.title: Steer the car in the direction of the spot.
steps.content: Steer the car in the direction of the spot. Move the wheel left or right to maneuver your car in the direction of the spot. [1] X Research source You should approach the spot going no faster than 5 mph (8.0 km/h).

steps.title: Lightly place your foot on the brake.
steps.content: Lightly place your foot on the brake. This will help you pull into the spot at the right speed and not overshoot your target. This is particularly useful if you're parking in front of a wall and. It'll help you maintain control of the car.

steps.title: Pull into the parking space.
steps.content: Pull into the parking space. Take care to avoid hitting the curb or other cars in your way. Focus on your depth perception: have a firm sense of how close all of the objects in your way really are.

steps.title: Press down on the brake.
steps.content: Press down on the brake. Once you've pulled into the spot, it's time to firmly press down on the brake so the car comes to a complete stop.

steps.title: Turn your wheels in the right direction.
steps.content: Turn your wheels in the right direction. Keep your foot on the brake as you turn your wheels in the right direction. If you're pulling into a flat spot, just straighten your wheels. If you've parked uphill, you can turn your wheels away from the curb, and if you've parked downhill, you can turn your wheels toward the curb. [2] X Research source This will keep your car from rolling away if your brakes are disengaged. Shift to first gear (or reverse) and set the parking brake. [3] X Research source By leaving both the transmission and the parking brake engaged, you have 2 systems holding your car in place, which can help protect you in case one of them fails.

steps.title: Set the parking brake in place.
steps.content: Set the parking brake in place.

steps.title: Slowly steer the car in the direction of the spot.
steps.content: Slowly steer the car in the direction of the spot. Move the wheel left or right to position the car into the spot. You should approach the spot going no faster than 5 mph (8.0 km/h). If you're directly in front of the spot, this part is easy. If you're trying to maneuver into a space between two cars that is perpendicular to you, then you have to create an arc wide enough for you to turn into the spot. When you're first turning, it may feel like you're overshooting the spot and will hit the car further away from you. Just lightly apply pressure to the brake and quickly turn the wheel in the direction of the spot to comfortably slide the car into place.

steps.title: Lightly press the brake.
steps.content: Lightly press the brake. This will help you maintain control of your car while moving it in the right direction.

steps.title: Pull into the parking space.
steps.content: Pull into the parking space. You can lightly put your foot on the brake to make sure that you don't overshoot the spot.

steps.title: Press down on the brake.
steps.content: Press down on the brake. Instead of lightly hitting the brake, you should firmly press the brake so the car comes to a complete stop.

steps.title: Turn your wheels in the right direction.
steps.content: Turn your wheels in the right direction. Keep your foot on the brake as you turn your wheels in the right direction. If you're pulling into a flat spot, just straighten your wheels. If you've parked uphill, you can turn your wheels away from the curb, and if you've parked downhill, you can turn your wheels toward the curb. This will keep your car from rolling away if your brakes are disengaged.

steps.title: Shift the car into Park (P) and set the parking brake in place.
steps.content: Shift the car into Park (P) and set the parking brake in place.

steps.title: Shift to Reverse (R).
steps.content: Shift to Reverse (R). Once you're within just a car's length or further away from the spot, you should switch into Reverse before you start backing up.

steps.title: Apply light pressure to the brake.
steps.content: Apply light pressure to the brake. This will help you maintain control of your car as you back up.

steps.title: Steer your car in the direction of the spot.
steps.content: Steer your car in the direction of the spot. This is a bit trickier when you're parking backwards, because you'll actually have to steer the wheel in the opposite direction that you want the car to go, instead of the same direction. If you want your car to move left, you'll have to steer to the right.

steps.title: Pull into the spot.
steps.content: Pull into the spot. You can check your mirrors to start moving backwards -- or better yet, put your right arm around the left passenger seat, and look behind you. You'll have a better sense of where to move your car if you're actually looking at the space.

steps.title: Press the brake firmly.
steps.content: Press the brake firmly. Once you've moved the car in the right space, press the brake firmly until the car comes to a complete stop.

steps.title: Pull into the spot.
steps.content: Pull into the spot. You can check your mirrors to start moving backwards -- or better yet, put your right arm around the left passenger seat, and look behind you. You'll have a better sense of where to move your car if you're actually looking at the space.

steps.title: Press the brake firmly.
steps.content: Press the brake firmly. Once you've moved the car in the right space, press the brake firmly until the car comes to a complete stop.

steps.title: Shift to Park (P).
steps.content: Shift to Park (P).

steps.title: Set the parking brake in place.
steps.content: Set the parking brake in place.

steps.title: Check your rear-view mirrors.
steps.content: Check your rear-view mirrors. Make sure that there's no car behind you before you try to parallel park. If there is a car behind you, wait for it to pass or pull into a driveway or side-street ahead, and then approach the spot again.

steps.title: Turn on your signal.
steps.content: Turn on your signal. This will let other cars know that you're parking.

steps.title: Slow down your car.
steps.content: Slow down your car. Shift your transmission down so that you approach the spot at no more than 2–3 mph (3.2–4.8 km/h). If you're driving an automatic car, just lightly press the brake, and if you're driving a manual car, shift down to a lower gear and lightly press the brake.

steps.title: Pull your car so that it's parallel with the car in front of the open space.
steps.content: Pull your car so that it's parallel with the car in front of the open space. It should be at least a foot apart from the car. If it's too close, then you may hit the car when you start moving backward. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Shift into Reverse (R).
steps.content: Shift into Reverse (R).

steps.title: Back up.
steps.content: Back up. Continue to check your mirrors and blind spots to make sure that the coast is still clear. [5] X Research source Turn around before you begin to move backwards.

steps.title: Turn your wheel toward the curb.
steps.content: Turn your wheel toward the curb.

steps.title: Lightly press the gas.
steps.content: Lightly press the gas. If you're driving an automatic car, that's all you need to do. If you're driving a manual car, then you should slowly let go of the clutch as you press the gas. If you're parking on a hill, then you can keep pressing the clutch and just slowly move your foot off the brake.

steps.title: Move the car backward until it's halfway in the parking space.
steps.content: Move the car backward until it's halfway in the parking space.

steps.title: Steer your wheel away from the curb.
steps.content: Steer your wheel away from the curb. Continue to back up until you're fully in the space. You may not get it on your first try. You can move back and steer your wheel away from the curb, then move forward again while steering your wheel toward the curb, and repeat this process until you've got it right.

steps.title: Park the car.
steps.content: Park the car. Shift it into first gear if you're driving a manual car, and shift the car into Park if you're driving Pull forward until you're evenly positioned between the car in front of you and the car behind you.

steps.title: Turn your wheels in the right direction.
steps.content: Turn your wheels in the right direction. Keep your foot on the brake as you turn your wheels in the right direction. If you're pulling into a flat spot, just straighten your wheels. If you've parked uphill, you can turn your wheels away from the curb, and if you've parked downhill, you can turn your wheels toward the curb. This will keep your car from rolling away if your brakes are disengaged.

steps.title: Shift into first gear.
steps.content: Shift into first gear. Pull forward until you're evenly positioned between the car in front of you and the car behind you.

steps.title: Pull up your parking brake.
steps.content: Pull up your parking brake.
